The Crack in The Sky
Language
Once upon a time there was a cow.
The cow lived on an small planet, called Configura.
In the house lived Hildas friend Squilda.
The milk gave Squilda all the food she needed, for Hilda was a quite magical cow and her milk was very powerfully potent.
They were good friends and would often sit up in the evenings, looking at the stars and talking.
Then one night, after they had both gone to sleep, a sound woke them.
The sound was coming from above! And there seemed to be a crack of light up above, like the sky was ice that someone heavy was standing on.
The two friends wondered what kind of creatures might be on the other side of the crack, maybe they had squirly legs or maybe they could fly around and live on the clouds?

They used the powers of Hildas milk to run the rocket, and built its body of leaves from the bush, bound together with branches from the tree. For the top of the rocket they used the roof of their house.
They spoke the magic words to the milk and the rocket took off! Up, up, up, up and away!
It was daylight on the other side. They landed upon a grassy hill.
A creature approached them. He came right up and boffed them on the face, which made them realize he was a friend.

Valfiskdrake taught them that they could use the balls that were instead of water in the sea to bounce with. He told them he could lead the way to the creature who had made the crack. So they followed him.
Valfiskdrake explained that the crack had come from an owl-like creature in a lab high in the mountains.
Higher and higher they went, until they arrived at a little cottage near the peak of a mountain.
In owls cottage, lightning was going off from a big machine. The machine shook back and forth.
When Hilda and Squilda came in, Owl was startled and jumped, but Valfiskdrake came in and boffed him on the face, which calmed him down.
I have three machines, said Owl, jumping around the kitchen to show them, and my Mom is gone so I dont know which of them to use to make tea!
Squilda knew! She took the littlest machine and came back quick as a flash with hot steaming tea!
Owl was such a much happier Owl when he had drunk his tea. He fiddled his ears and jumped with pleasure!
It was a music-machine!
After drinking a lot more tea, and a lot more dancing, the sun began to set. It was time for Hilda and Squilda to go home.
It was dark when Hilda and Squilda came back to the ship, and they could see the light of their sky through the crack.
When Owls mom came home, she fixed the hole in the sky, but she left a little crack open, so that the friends could see each other and visit each other from time to time...

Artists:
Rakel Grabka - Owl and Fj√§rilsvaldrake
Henrik Jacobsson - Lightning 
Olivia Lundhqvist - book icon.
Lorem Ipsum
The cows name was Hilda.
The planet of Configura had one tree, one bush and one house.
Squilda had 5 tentacles and would milk Hilda every morning.
They would often wonder what was out there...
It was a creaking sound, as if something were about to break.
And then, "Crack!" "Boom" "Swoosh!" the sky broke and there was a big hole!
They decided to build a rocket to find out!
He told them his name was Valfiskdrake.
So on they went towards Owl, and when they got high enough they got on a cloud, because on this planet the clouds were strong, and people and things were light.
Do you know? he asked.
They decided to let the sky-breaking machine be, and go find out what the last machine could be?
They said good bye to their new friends Valfiskdrake and Owl, and started floating back towards their spaceship.
The rocket zipped up and in two blinks they were gone through the crack.
THE END!
Story and Application by David Jacobsson
